intro: Chrysanthemum cebennense, commonly known as the Cebennese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Chrysanthemum cebennense is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
